lines.text:
[trying to tutor Angela in history]
Well... you listen to music?
Yeah.
You sing along, right?

[hardly paying attention]
Sure.
Well, you remember the words, right?
That's different.
No! No, no, it's not different. You can learn new lyrics, like, for D-Day.
[Wayne starts singing improvised lyrics to 'That'll be the Day']
Battle of D-Day, the Second World War. Battle of D-Day, nineteen forty-four. Battle of D-Day, I'll say it once more. When Eisenhower led the troops to Normandy's shore.
[Angela smiles, impressed]

[teaching Wayne to dance]
So you'll come to the prom?

[scoffs]
I'll see if Ann-Margret is free.
I'm not joking!
Angela, come on! There's not a girl in school who'd go out with me on a bet. I mean, look at me.
Look, Wayne. If you see a girl you want, grab her and kiss her, and don't be afraid of what anyone thinks. They're not there, Wayne. There's no one on Earth except you and that girl.
Well...

[shakes her head]
No, Wayne. There's no one on Earth.
[Wayne suddenly leans in and kisses Angela]
I-I'm sorry... I just don't...
Do that again.
[he kisses her again]
Do you really think she'd fall for you? She felt sorry for you! That's all!
What are you doing here? Shocking! You died at least ten years before I did.

[shocked]
I died?
You really do not pay attention. You'd better come to my office.

[about Angela's death]
Look on the bright side. At least you checked out the pretty dress. I had a heart attack at a Halloween party.
Dad, in this town, you need a car that's sturdy and dependable.
Dogs are dependable. A car should be snazzy.
What do you want from me? What do I have to do get rid of you?

[kneels beside Cindy]
Help me find out what my mission is.
And then what?
I turn in my homework, kiss Limbo goodbye, catch the staircase to heaven, and party all night with James Dean!
[Angela stretches out on Cindy's bed with a dreamy look]
[Angela is trying to teach Cindy to walk 'cool']
Come on, move, move! Dare anybody to think you're uncool!
[Cindy and Angela hear a wolf-whistle]
What did I tell you?
[Cindy turns to see a parrot just outside a pet store]

[wolf whistling again]
Hey babe!
Terrific! A BIRD thinks I'm cool!
Well, it's a start.
Did you really think we would send you back from the dead to go shopping? Now, this is it for you, Angela! You got a second chance! Most people don't. Make the most of it.
How? I mean, you're supposed to be my guidance counselor. Give me some guidance!
Oh, great! I'm flunking the afterlife!
[Angela's thrown a spitball at Wayne]

[looking around angrily, and then at Cindy]
Who was that? You?
Oh, my God!

[to Cindy]
Speak up!
I don't believe it, that's him!
Who?
The boy that I left at the prom!

[to Cindy]
You!

[to Angela]
Flunkenstein?
[all the students laugh]

[furious]
Out of the classroom.
But I...
Out! You're suspended.
Drop dead.
I already AM dead!
Get deader. Just leave me alone!
Now, I might have been someone to push around when I was a student here, but I'm a teacher now. If your daughter expects to pass history, that will be respected. Good day, Mrs. Boyd!

[trying to set up Cindy with Mike at a video store]
Ask for Top Gun.

[scoffs]
Hated that movie.
Tonight? It's your favorite.

You dope! I led her right into your lap and you dropped her! What are you waiting for? Do you want to be dead for the rest of your life? I'm the one who got killed! But you didn't die, Wayne. You just gave up.
[Wayne continues playing his saxophone]
Take that thing out of your mouth!
[Angela pulls on one of the keys of Wayne's saxophone]
Damn...
That's right. You can't concentrate, can you? You know why? You're thinking of HER!
[Wayne starts to look at his reflection in the glass window]
And you SHOULD be! I can see what you're feeling. You had that same glow in your eyes when you used to look at me. Use it. It's time, Wayne. Let go of the past. You've GOT to be able to hear me!
[Angela's voice grows passionate, as Wayne stares at his reflection with a look of pain]
Of course you can. Grab her. And kiss her. And don't be afraid of what anyone thinks. They're not there, Wayne. There's no one on Earth except you and...
Judith...

[about Cindy]
All right. So I meddled a little.
You meddled a lot. You solved one problem and started another.
For your information, Cindy is having the time of her life with the boy of her dreams, as we speak!

[snarls]
You haven't learned ANYTHING, have you?
What IS this, a quiz? Cindy's got what she wanted!
You led her down the same stupid path as you got stuck on in high school, and look what became of you!

[getting scared]
... what? You mean, Cindy's in danger?
You both are.
When I first moved to this school, I was nobody. Everybody laughed at me. Nobody but Peter would even speak to me. I had no friends.
Wrong. You had one friend. Now you have no friends.
Get out of my car!
It's raining!
Get wet!
Duke... did you really think she'd fall for you? She felt sorry for you. That's all.

[about his music]
You know, you're real good, Wayne. You could have been a professional if you wanted to.
I did want to.
Well, what stopped you, wayne?
...life.
